page_analysis.text_content:
Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

• Fireplaces shall be included in the gross floor area (counted one time) regardless of configura-
tion or design.
• Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area
regardless of configuration or design.

Fig 14 Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, etc.

Chimneys on the
upper floors DO
NOT COUNT

Height

Note: In 2000, the city of Palo Alto
passed an ordinance prohibiting the
construction of new wood-burning fire-
places. For details about and possible
hibition, see the
ter 9.06.030

All configurations of fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses
COUNT ONCE towards the gross floor area.
Note: Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated
like accessory structures, they and count towards FAR if
they are greater than 120 sf. They count towards lot
coverage always, regardless of size.

Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool
sheds, equipment enclosures, play
houses, etc., that are greater than 5' in
height, DO COUNT toward gross floor
area. (Note: Neither appendages like
this nor noise-producing equipment may
be located in the required yards).

19

visual_elements.description: An isometric line drawing of a house with multiple chimneys and a small shed-like structure. The house has a pitched roof. There are three chimneys depicted: one on the upper floor, one on the ground floor, and another on the ground floor. The shed-like structure is separate from the house. Arrows and text labels point to specific elements: 'Chimneys on the upper floors DO NOT COUNT' points to the upper chimney. 'Height' is labeled next to the shed. A dashed line indicates the ground level. Callouts explain how different elements are counted towards gross floor area or FAR.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

technical_specifications.parameter: Projection height threshold for gross floor area count
Accessory structure area threshold for FAR count

structural_elements.main_heading: Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

additional_notes: The text 'hibition, see the ter 9.06.030' appears to be a truncated sentence, likely 'prohibition, see the Chapter 9.06.030' due to the layout of the text box.
The page number '19' is located at the bottom right corner of the page.
cross_references: Chapter 9.06.030 (for details on wood-burning fireplace prohibition in Palo Alto)
